# Task

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.



# Data

timezone_bumper(DateTime(2023, 4, 10, 12, 0),3)

# Solution:

```julia
using DateTime

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime, bump::Int = 3)
    if typeof(dt) == Date
        error("timezone_bumper only works with DateTime types")
    else
        hours = dt.hour + bump
        minutes = dt.minute
        seconds = dt.second
        timezone_offset = dt.utcoffset()
        new_utc_offset = timezone_offset + TimeZone(hours, 0)
        new_dt = DateTime(dt.year, dt.month, dt.day, hours, minutes, seconds, new_utc_offset)
        return new_dt
    end
end
```
